dayOnePreamble: ^Hmph! Ginoo ray kabalo unsa akong gibati right now... your father... well, he would've wanted me to keep strong-
^he wanted you to have this place if you ever decided to come back.
^And now that you are, does that mean you'll be in charge of things around here now?
^Yes.  I want to keep my Tatay's legacy of being one of the few albularyos left here.
^Maayo nimo Rene,  I'm sure your father will be understanding with whatever you choose to do with your life either way...
^Anyways! I'm not here as a customer-
^I just wanted you to know that your father mentioned he has this book where he keeps all his notes and spells,
^it'll be very useful for you- so keep it close with you the entire time and make sure to thumb through it!
^Hello po… I want to get 3 photos restored today if that’s alright. They’re photos of the family that have been damaged - they were hidden in a box somewhere.
^No problem! If you’ll just put them on the table for me, I’ll get right on it.
^(Alright Rene, just focus on the part of the photo to fix, bring the amulet's stone to it, and then cast the spell...)
^(I can probably find the damage and method to cast the spell in the book, but I'll have to learn the subject myself.)
^(Probably shouldn't mess up the spell too much, I think I only have enough mana to prevent 3 miscasted spells.)
dayOneEnding: ^You… you killed your own daughter… and you left your poor apo an orphan. How can you live with yourself?
^My albularyo heritage focuses on memories. Our healing starts with the mind. You should’ve known this the moment you stepped inside the shop.
^Tch... kids these days. I thought I was just going to get some photos fixed.
^I’ve always known that I’m not a perfect person. I’m not even a good person.
^I pushed away my daughter and granddaughter for the sake of some vision I had for Maria’s life.
^I misplaced my anger - I despised that man, and yet my fury ended up engulfing poor Maria as well.
^I just wanted Maria to have a better life than I had.
^I lived through wars, witch hunts, poverty - I just wanted her as far away from all that as possible.
^Or maybe I just wanted to see her live out the dreams I had which I could not.
^You’d never know. Maybe she still could have made her way in the world if she was alive.
^I battle that guilt everyday - it takes everything in my power to keep on going.
^My only other child doesn’t even talk to me anymore after he heard what I’ve done!
^I hid those photos in a box long ago so as to not be reminded of my mistakes.
^If only I was a bit more understanding.
^If only I was a bit more kind - I should have actually listened to Maria instead of imposing my will on her.
^What are you going to do now?
^Hays. I think I’m going to visit Miguel.
^Make good with the family that’s still here.
^I’ll make sure to be a better mother this time.
^Accept him wholeheartedly for who he is and the path he has chosen.
^So... musta mn imong first day back, and as a shop owner?
^Hah! Well, you're going to keep at this for a while now.
^I won't keep you, it was just nice seeing you in your tatay's shoes, I'm sure he's proud of you.
^Well, it should be time for you to close up shop, good luck, Rene!
^Thank you Tita Elena. Maningkamot rako diri.
firstPhotoDialogue: ^This was a photo of me and my kids back then...
^The photo was ruined after I spilled coffee on it, silly me!
^Some of the photo must have turned moldy from that...
^The boy in the photo is Miguel, who dropped out of med school to join a band.
^I told him jud to be a doctor and make money, pero he said he's not happy!
^Jusko lord. Dong. MONEY makes you happy.
^I sacrificed so much for him pa jud. And yet now, he doesn't talk to me!
^She really threw it all away in the end.
secondPhotoDialogue: ^This is another photo. My apo Isabella is to the right.
^To the left... Hays... You were taken from us too soon.
^This never would have happened if HE didn't rob you of your future.
^You left Isabella all alone... You left ME all alone.
thirdPhotoDialogue: ^I CURSE THAT MAN. HE TOOK AWAY YOUR FUTURE! MY FUTURE!
^You had so many dreams. I never approved of him.
